data.title: Próxima (2007)
data.meta_description: Tony, the owner of a small fantastic film video shop, has found out that at times reality can defy science-fiction. The time has come to embark on a trip to a place nobody has ever been to before.
data.text:
Proxima was the second feature-length film from Spanish director Carlos Atanes. Carlos Atanes had previously appeared with FAQ: Frequently Asked Questions, a dystopian science-fiction film that sat just between a profusion of interesting imagery, a satirical sense of humour and having inhaled a little too much of the 1960s French Nouvelle Vague. Atanes would subsequently go onto make Codex Atanicus, a collection of his short films.

Proxima is certainly a quantum leap outwards from the things that Carlos Atanes was starting to explore in FAQ. It is difficult to sum up what Proxima is in a nutshell. Perhaps if one imagines something akin to a conceptual collision between Free Enterprise about the lives of science-fiction fans and the reality-bending works…
